used to tell someone not to do something or to indicate distinction

to perform a song with voice
to move outward or leave a place

refers to all people in a group

used after a verb to indicate degree or result

indicates the position in a sequence as number one

english_descriptive: to hand something to someone or indicate the recipient of an action

english_descriptive: a large vehicle for carrying many passengers, usually along a fixed route

english_descriptive: used to describe something that costs a lot or to show respect

english_descriptive: used to indicate past experience or movement across

english_descriptive: a young person below the age of adulthood
used to describe food that tastes good
the color black

english_descriptive: a round or oval object laid by a hen, used as food

english_descriptive: to tell someone about another person or thing for the first time
to move from outside to inside
describes a short distance between two places or objects

english_descriptive: used to indicate a quick or early action, or emphasis

english_descriptive: to have an opinion or emotional response about something

english_descriptive: a drink made from roasted coffee beans

english_descriptive: to initiate or commence an activity or event

english_descriptive: a formal test of knowledge or ability

feeling the need to rest or sleep due to exertion

english_descriptive: a path or street for traveling by foot or vehicle
to go to different places for leisure or exploration

used to indicate each member of a group or series

long, thin strips of dough cooked and eaten as food
a person of the male sex

english_descriptive: a unit of time equivalent to 24 hours; also refers to the sun

the period of time after sunset and before going to bed

the side or direction to the right
